com.scalar.db.sql

Interface SqlSession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DirectModeSqlSession, ServerModeSqlSession

    public interface SqlSession
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    An SQL session in which users can execute all the operations (DDL, DML, etc.).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        java.lang.String begin()
        Begins a transaction.
        Returns:
        a transaction ID associated with the begun transaction
        Throws:
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • join

        void join(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Joins the specified transactions. This method is for the TWO_PHASE_COMMIT_TRANSACTION mode.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - a transaction ID associated with the transaction to join
        Throws:
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • suspend

        void suspend()
        Suspends the current transaction.
        Throws:
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • resume

        void resume(java.lang.String transactionId)
        Resumes an ongoing transaction associated with the specified transaction ID.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - a transaction ID associated with the transaction to resume
        Throws:
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • execute

        ResultSet execute(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes the specified SQL statement.
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement to execute
        Returns:
        a ResultSet object that contains the data produced by the query
        Throws:
        TransactionConflictException - if a transaction conflict happens
        UnknownTransactionStatusException - if the transaction status (committed or aborted) is unknown when executing the COMMIT statement
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • execute

        ResultSet execute(Statement statement)
        Executes the specified statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - a statement to execute
        Returns:
        a ResultSet object that contains the data produced by the query
        Throws:
        TransactionConflictException - if a transaction conflict happens
        UnknownTransactionStatusException - if the transaction status (committed or aborted) is unknown when executing the COMMIT statement
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • prepareStatement

        PreparedStatement prepareStatement(java.lang.String sql)
        Returns a PreparedStatement object with the specified SQL statement.
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement to prepare
        Returns:
        a PreparedStatement object

      • prepareStatement

        PreparedStatement prepareStatement(BindableStatement<?> bindableStatement)
        Returns a PreparedStatement object with the specified statement.
        Parameters:
        bindableStatement - a statement to prepare
        Returns:
        a PreparedStatement object

      • prepare

        void prepare()
        Prepares the current transaction. This method is for the TWO_PHASE_COMMIT_TRANSACTION mode.
        Throws:
        TransactionConflictException - if a transaction conflict happens
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • validate

        void validate()
        Validates the current transaction. This method is for the TWO_PHASE_COMMIT_TRANSACTION mode.
        Throws:
        TransactionConflictException - if a transaction conflict happens
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commits the current transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionConflictException - if a transaction conflict happens
        UnknownTransactionStatusException - if the transaction status (committed or aborted) is unknown
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        Rolls back the current transaction. If a transaction is not begun, does nothing.

      • isTransactionInProgress

        boolean isTransactionInProgress()
        Returns whether a transaction is in progress.
        Returns:
        whether a transaction is in progress
        Throws:
        SqlException - if an unexpected error happens
